title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 226-2.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 226-2.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) To the extent
that they are not inconsistent with the specific definitions in this section, the general definitions of Part 200 of this Title apply. For the purposes of
this Subpart, the following specific definitions also apply: 1)
'Cleaning Tool.' An item used to aid
cleaning, such as wiping rags, brushes, mops, scrapers, or water
jets. 2)
'Industrial Cleaning

Solvent.' Any liquid containing a volatile organic compound (VOC) used to
facilitate the removal of foreign materials from a surface. 3)
'Unit Operation.' An industrial operation, classified or grouped according to its function in an operating environment, such as mixing or holding vessels, tanks, reactors, floors or other surfaces to
be cleaned. 4)
'Unit Operation

Systems.' The ensemble of equipment around which a material balance is
performed. It includes all possible points/sources that could result in losses
to the atmosphere as a result of the equipment being cleaned, including losses
during dispensing of cleaning materials, losses from residual cleaning
materials on or in cleaning tools, and losses from storing cleaning
materials. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
226-2.2

Adopted

New

York State Register October 23, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 43, eff. 11/1/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
